item.title: Gibss phenomena in one-dimensional signals
item.author: Author
item.description: 1 Introduction It is well known that a well suitable one-dimensional signal (or function) in $\mathcal{L}^{2}$ can be expanded and encoded in the coefficients of the Fourier series $\mathbb{R}$ 2 Advances 2.1 Two-dimensional fields There’s 2.2 Final thoughts Another
